text:
Chrono Cross was a sequel to what happened in Chrono Trigger.
Just one sequel, out of infinite possibilities that we in our insignificant lives can never experience.
The corridors of time will go on.
But we'll always have that short and bittersweet moment together.
author: dankie poo

text: One of the best games for ps1 ever created along with Xenogears and other great RPGs (too many to mention, but those two were my fav)
author: Oscar Araque

text: Beautiful :')
author: Lee R.

text: Having played the translated Radical Dreamers and having read about how ridiculously complicated Chrono Cross' plot and underlying backstory is I can safely say that the latter was not just a "rehash" of the former. I have no links to back this up since it was an image, but without a doubt chrono cross is the most intellectually challenging story in video games. I couldn't even fathom it's complexity while it was being spelled out to me by that image.
author: FrogFraction

text: +DarkWave if only the characters dind't had a nonexistal personality.

text: +Celio Hogane Always thought that was one of the greatest travesties in RPG history.

text: Well, Sir, hell yes!
author: Lucas Medina

text: Lovely soundtrack
author: knasbollicus

text:
CC answers the question that CT poses, "What happens to the futures that disappear when the past changes?" Without CT, CC wouldn't exist. Could they make it work without any of the connections? Yes, but as it stands it is a sequel and I think it's unfair to say otherwise.

As for the battle system and what-not, I think that's more of it being a sequel and trying something new rather than reusing the same thing. Besides things like techs were still in, so they kept some things.
author: talesfan573

text: Not a sequel, but a successor to the name "Chrono." Many people see it as a sequel when they shouldn't. Due to Chrono Triggers positive ratings many people assumed this game would be just as great or even better, but their expectations were a bit to high. This game should be treated as it's own game. A great game with a memorable sound track.
author: Jeffrey Garcia

text: I bought this game, got 10 hours in. Didn't like it, took it back and got the 4 disk sound track instead. Best summer ever!
author: Hannah Sloat

text: More like a game in the same series... If that makes sense. Not a sequel in the true sense (As in, Half-Life and Half-Life 2 being a continuation) but it fits appropriately enough to be in the same series.

text: I feel the same. I've also noticed his comments throughout the videos. Usually in the top comments section.
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: Chrono Cross' story is a rehashed plot from an interactive novel called Radical Dreamers. It features many of the same songs and characters from that 'game.' It was fitted to be the 'sequel' of Chrono Trigger but ties in so loosely it's almost shameful on Square's part. Regardless, the game is quite well done and the soundtrack is superb, as Mitsuda usually dishes out.
author: ShadowKinesis

text: Those memories man. Can't beat em'.

text: I'm surprised you didn't have this uploaded already, heh.  This was always one of my favorite tracks from my all-time favorite soundtrack.  Anyway, great game; they took the great world of Chrono Trigger and fixed its only weaknesses (generic battle system and weak character development) to one-up what was already a masterpiece.

text: Sort of. It does follow A story from Chrono Trigger, though you wouldn't know what one until quite late into the game when the pieces of the whole game fall into place. It's admittingly a controversial point of the game that for many either makes, or breaks the game. I'd say though as most tend to agree that it's still a good game, and even better actually if you take it on it's own merits and just enjoy it for what it is rather than cry that it's not a DIRECT sequel to CT and a different cast.
